result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: 11:48 AM Defendant Isaac Mercado-Sanchez in court and Interpreter, Jim Larson - S&T, by Zoom audio and video.  Court questions DE regarding not completing the Petition.  DE did not understand the form.  DE is not currently working.  Court questions DE regarding income and expenses.  Court reviews financial information.  Court finds conditionally indigent.   Court appoints Attorney Amber Lucsay 314 Ash Street, Baraboo, WI 53913 (608) 216-7000 @$100/hr and reimbursement @ $50.00/month commencing May 15, 2022, directly to the Sauk Co. Clerk of Courts.
No contact w/M.M.M. or her residence or employment.   May retrieve your belongings if accompanied by a law enforcement officer upon prior notice, one time.

Indigency hearing on April 29, 2022 at 11:45 am.
Pre-trial conference on May 27, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on June 30, 2022 at 09:30 am.

02:38 PM Defendant Isaac Mercado-Sanchez by Zoom audio and video from LEC with attorney Allison A Markoski by Zoom audio and video and Interpreter, Eric Roland - S&T, by Zoom audio and video.  Defendant Isaac Mercado-Sanchez in custody.  Gabriel David Arevalo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant received and waives reading of complaint.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  Advised of rights to an attorney.  DE does not qualify for public defender representation and intends to apply for court appointed counsel.  Atty Markoski confirms DE's address.  Time limits waived for preliminary hearing.  State recommends a signature bond.  No objection from Atty Markoski.  Recess at 2:49 PM for Atty Markoski and DE to privately speak.  $1,000.00 SIGNATURE bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows: No contact with M.M.M. or her residence or employment.  DE may return one time, upon prior notice and with LE to retrieve any personal property.  DE may not leave the State of WI.  Indigency hearing scheduled for April 29, 2022 at 11:45 am.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 09:30 am.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 27, 2022 at 10:00 am.
